availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick Stumbaugh (Paintsville, Kentucky, farmer and soldier (U.S.A.))

body.p: Paintsville, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Stambaugh. Married to Sarah Short Stumbaugh in Johnson County, Kentucky on August 14, 1853. Father of James Stumbaugh, Thomas J. Stumbaugh, Isaac W. Stumbaugh, and Rachel S. Stumbaugh. Farmer in Johnson County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Paintsville, Kentucky in 1860. Served as second lieutenant in the Sandy Valley Battalion of the 1st Regiment Capital Guards from August 9, 1864 to March 11, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 774.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson, p. 82B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson, p. 207.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson, Hood's Fork, p. 151A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriages, Film #001912950.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #563531.
